label: Key Term Definitions
Education/Employment Background
text: *PARTY 1*'s employment/income details include: [job title/employer], earning approximately $[amount] annually. May include self-employment, unemployment, re-training plans, or caregiving status.

label: Education/Employment Background
text: *PARTY 2*'s employment/income details include: [job title/employer], earning approximately $[amount] annually. May include self-employment, unemployment, re-training plans, or caregiving status.

label: Incorporation and Accuracy of Background
text: All background facts form part of this Agreement. Each party confirms their truth and the other's reliance on them.

label: Day to Day Decision Making
text: The party with whom the child is scheduled to be according to the parenting time schedule will make the day-to-day decisions affecting the child during that time.

label: Joint Decision Making
text: *PARTY 1* and *PARTY 2* will have joint decision-making responsibility and will make important decisions about the child's welfare together, including decisions about health, education, culture, language, religion and spirituality, and significant extra-curricular activities.

label: Sole Decision Making
text: One parent will have sole decision-making responsibility and will make important decisions about the child's welfare, including health, education, culture, language, religion and spirituality, and extra-curricular activities.

label: Split Decision Making
text: Each parent will have split decision-making authority over specific areas of the child's welfare. Each must consult with the other before making final decisions and give written notice 30 days in advance.

label: Parenting Plan
text: *PARTY 1* and *PARTY 2* will honour their Parenting Plan, attached as a Schedule to this Agreement.

label: Equal Parenting Time - Alternate Weeks
text: Parenting time will be equally split in alternating weeks, with each parent responsible for transportation during their time.

label: Equal Parenting Time - Split Two-Week Rotation (2-2-5-5)
text: Parenting follows a structured two-week rotating schedule with alternating mid-week and weekend exchanges.

label: Alternate Weekends & One Evening
text: Parenting is shared across a repeating two-week schedule with clear transitions and alternating weekends.

label: Alternate Weekends & One Overnight
text: One parent will have primary parenting time, the other will have mid-week and alternate weekend time, and be responsible for transitions.

label: Supervised Parenting - Access Centre
text: If parenting time is supervised, the location, times, and supervisor (e.g., access center or relative) must be specified in the agreement.

label: No Parenting time
text: PARTY A or PARTY B will have no parenting time until further agreement or court order.

label: Holiday Schedule – General
text: This holiday schedule is in addition to the regular parenting time above, and overrides the regular parenting time in the event of conflict. (The regular parenting time above and this holiday schedule are collectively referred to as the "parenting time schedule".)
[There will be no make-up time for missed parenting time, unless the parties agree otherwise.] [If a party misses their parenting time, the parties will arrange make-up time.]
label: Make-Up Parenting Time

text: The parties wish to engage [name of parenting coordinator]. If that person cannot act, they will refer to an alternate; failing that, the parties will select another mutually agreeable coordinator by [method].
label: Parenting Coordinator – Appointment

text: The parties will share the [up-front] cost of the parenting coordinator [equally] [_____ % / _____ %].
label: Parenting Coordinator – Cost Sharing

text: If the parties have not resolved the parenting dispute after [number] days, the parenting coordinator will arbitrate the dispute[, and may reapportion costs].
label: Parenting Coordinator – Arbitration After X Days

text: Any arbitration will be conducted under the Arbitration Act and will constitute a secondary arbitration under that Act and the Provincial legislation Act.
label: Parenting Coordinator – Arbitration Act

text: The parenting coordinator's decision ("award") will be binding. The award may be appealed to the court [as of right on questions of (law) (fact) (mixed law and fact)].
label: Parenting Coordinator – Binding Award

text: The parties will enter into a Parenting Coordination Agreement consistent with these terms[, attached as a Schedule to this Agreement].
label: Parenting Coordinator – Agreement

text: The parties have equal/shared parenting time. Each will pay monthly Table child support adjusted as per circumstances, and contribute to section 7 expenses.
label: Equal Parenting Time

text: Child lives primarily with one party, but the other has 40%+ time. Each party pays adjusted Table child support and contributes to section 7 expenses.
label: Shared Parenting Time

text: One party has primary parenting time. The other pays full monthly Table support and their share of section 7 expenses.
label: Primary Parenting Time

text: Split parenting: each party pays Table support for the child(ren) in the other's primary care. Net amount is offset monthly.
label: Split Parenting Time

text: The parties have one child. Additional parenting role history during the marriage may impact support claims.
label: Children of the Marriage/Relationship

text: This Dispute Resolution section applies to disputes or proposed changes relating to reviewable or variable terms, relocations, and significant parenting changes.
label: Dispute Resolution

text: In shared parenting time arrangements, each party is entitled to 50% of applicable child-related tax credits and benefits.
label: Equal/Shared Parenting Time

text: One or both parties may claim the Eligible Dependant Credit depending on which child(ren) primarily reside with each.
label: Split Parenting Time

text: Material change can be foreseeable or unforeseeable, including significant income shifts, hardship, parenting time changes, or health changes.
label: what constitutes material changes

text: If _____ or _____ dies, the surviving party will assume all primary parenting responsibilities, including parenting time and decision-making for _____. Both parties will make wills consistent with this section.
label: Death of One Parent

text: Upon receiving notice of proposed relocation, the parties will work together [independently or with counsel] to review and revise the parenting time schedule[ and decision-making responsibility] and related issues, and may mediate the dispute if needed.
label: Relocation – Collaborate to Revise Schedule

text: If the matter is unresolved, the non-relocating party will, within 30 days, serve an objection in the prescribed form under the [Divorce Act], stating the objection, reasons, views on parenting proposals, and any other prescribed information.
label: Relocation – Objection Notice

text: _____ and _____ will live near each other to facilitate the parenting time and the decision-making responsibility with respect to _____, as set out in this Agreement.
label: Relocation – Live Near for Parenting & Decision-Making

text: _____ and _____ will live near each other to facilitate the parenting time with _____, set out in this Agreement.
label: Residence Proximity

text: Grandparents will have reasonable contact with _____, to be exercised for the most part when the party that is their child has parenting time with _____.
label: Grandparents – Contact During Parent Time

text: Grandparents will have the right to care for _____ when the party that is their child has parenting time with _____ but is unavailable to care for her.
label: Grandparents – Care When Parent Unavailable

text: Both parties may attend all school functions regardless of the parenting time schedule.
label: School Functions Attendance

text: If _____ is sick, the transition from one party's care to the other party's care is to proceed according to the parenting time schedule unless _____ is too sick to travel between the parties' homes according to _____ 's doctor.
label: Transitions When Child Is Sick

text: Neither party will arrange activities for _____ during the other party's scheduled parenting time without the other party's consent.
label: No Activities During Other Party's Time

text: The parenting time schedule will only be altered if both parties agree.
label: Alterations to Schedule

text: The party with whom _____ are scheduled to be according to the parenting time schedule will be solely and financially responsible for making childcare arrangements during their parenting time, including making alternate arrangements when unable to care for _____ due to illness, employment responsibilities, etc. [after first confirming that the other party is (and the other grandparents are) not available pursuant to the right-of-first-refusal section below.]
label: Childcare Responsibility During Own Time

text: If _____ will be in the care of a third party for more than one overnight during a party's' scheduled parenting time[, after first confirming that the other party is (and the other grandparents are) not available pursuant to the right-of-first-refusal section below], that party will advise the other party by email and will provide the name, address and phone number of the third party.
label: Third-Party Care Overnights

text: _____ will spend their birthday in accordance with the regular parenting time schedule.
label: Child's Birthday

text: If emergency medical care is needed during parenting time, the parent present must notify the other parent promptly.
label: Emergency Medical Care

text: The Agreement is intended to resolve: (a) parenting/support; (b) spousal support (final or interim); (c) property rights and estate claims.
label: Intended Purpose of Agreement

text: This is an Interim Agreement on selected issues such as parenting, child/spousal support, and will expire on [date].
label: Interim Agreement

text: Either party has child[ren] from a previous relationship. Their involvement or lack of standing in loco parentis may affect child support obligations.
label: Children from Prior Marriages/Relationships

text: "Table" and "income" mean those terms as defined in s. 2(1) of the Guidelines; "section 7 expenses" are defined in s. 7(1); "child support" includes both Table amount and section 7 expenses.
label: Definitions Relating to Child Support

text: For determining child support: PARTY A income is $[amount]; PARTY B income is $[amount].
label: Declaration Of Income

text: As of the Agreement date, arrears of child support owed are $[amount].
label: Arrears

text: Arrears payments are in addition to ongoing child support obligations.
label: Arrears Paid in addition to Ongoing Child Support

text: Each party supports the child independently with no contribution from the other. This arrangement is reasonable under the Guidelines.
label: No Child Support Payable

text: A lump sum child support payment of $[amount] satisfies all future child support obligations.
label: Lump Sum Child Support

text: A party pays more than Table amount due to increased household expenses or other valid reasons.
label: Child Support More Than Table Amount

text: Undue hardship will be reviewed after one year, with disclosure exchanged and child support adjusted if applicable.
label: Review Of Undue Hardship

text: Child support terminates upon specific events including: turning 18, becoming self-supporting, marriage, or death, unless exceptions apply.
label: Consent Required for Contribution

text: Child support terminates when a child is no longer defined as a 'child of the marriage' or equivalent under provincial legislation.
label: Termination - Detailed

text: Support may resume if a child who left school later returns full-time and is still under the defined age limit.
label: Determining Child Support for Remaining Children

text: Parties agree to review child support annually upon request. If no agreement is reached, dispute resolution will be used.
label: Automatic Annual Review

text: Each party must provide additional disclosure annually, including full income documentation, benefits, self-employment details, trust statements, and financial information relevant to child support.
label: Mandatory Disclosure

text: Parties will determine the Table amount of child support annually based on actual income and exchange of tax returns by May 1st (or June 15th if self-employed).
label: Variation Because of Change of Income

text: If parties disagree on the child support adjustment, they will use the Agreement's dispute resolution clause to resolve the issue.
label: Dispute Resolution - change in support

text: Either party may seek a variation of child support due to a material change in condition, needs, means, or other circumstances.
label: Material change in circumstances

text: Child support is indexed annually starting on [date]. Increases align with the Consumer Price Index from three months prior to the indexing date.
label: Indexing factor

text: Tax credits and child benefits do not affect the Table amount of child support unless specifically stated otherwise.
label: Tax credits or benefits

text: Child support will be paid through and enforced by the MAINTENANCE ENFORCEMENT AGENCY, and this Agreement will be filed with the court and agency.
label: Payment of Support through Maintenance Enforcement Agency

text: By December 1st annually, the payor will issue twelve post-dated cheques for child support for the following year.
label: Post Dated Checks

text: Child support may be paid via e-transfer to the recipient's specified email address on the first day of each month.
label: E-transfers

text: Child support may be paid by direct deposit from the payor's bank to the recipient's account on the first day of each month.
label: Bank Transfers

text: Interest at [number]% per year, compounded annually, will apply to any late child support payments, from default date to payment date.
label: Interest on Late Payments

text: Spousal support may be varied upon a material change in circumstances, including financial, child support, remarriage, cohabitation, or health.
label: Grounds for Variation

text: If child support ends or is reduced, and spousal support was reduced to accommodate child support, a review of spousal support may be requested.
label: Review When Child Support Ends

text: Either party may request a review of spousal support on a specified date, when child support ends or is reduced, or upon changes in cohabitation status.
label: Timing Of Spousal Support Review

text: Once child support ends, 30 days' written notice allows removal of the child from the payor's health plan.
label: Termination Of Coverage When Child Support Ends

text: Child support ending allows removal of the child from health insurance with 30 days' notice.
label: Notice to Insurer

text: The policy must remain active during and for one year following support obligations. Beneficiary must be irrevocably designated as security for child support.
label: Spouse as Beneficiary Outright

text: The Agreement satisfies support objectives under the INSERT PROVINCIAL LEGISLATION NAME HERE by recognizing each party's contribution, sharing child support burdens, encouraging independence, and relieving financial hardship.
label: Alternate - Interdependent Clause – Provincial laws

text: In full satisfaction of spousal support obligations, a lump sum payment of $[amount] will be made at signing [and additional amount on (date)].
label: Lump Sum Support

text: Spousal support will be $[amount] per month, starting [date] and ending [date]. On that date, support ends permanently and is non-variable.
label: Fixed Term Support

text: Spousal support of $[amount] per month begins on [date], with ongoing monthly payments on the first of each month.
label: Periodic Support

text: Spousal support previously paid since [date] is deemed compliant under this Agreement and the Income Tax Act. Deduction and inclusion rules apply.
label: Prior Payments

text: Both parties will register their child and spousal support arrangements with CRA using Form T1158.
label: CRA Acknowledgement and Registration

text: Upon request, the payor must provide an annual statement of spousal support received.
label: Termination

text: Spousal support terminates upon: (a) death of either party; (b) final payment on [date]; (c) death of payor without insurance; (d) court/arbitrator determination.
label: Termination at death

text: Spousal support may be reduced by $0.50 for every dollar that recipient's income exceeds $[threshold]. Adjustment takes effect the following month.
label: Reduction Formula

text: Overpayments of spousal support may be deducted over [number] months. If the obligation has ended, immediate repayment is required.
label: Overpayment

text: Spousal support will not change due to non-material events such as short-term cohabitation or income drops under a threshold.
label: What Does NOT Constitute Material Change

text: Spousal support may be changed in the event of voluntary or involuntary retirement. Voluntary retirement requires 6 months' written notice and applies prospectively.
label: Variation of Support in Event of Retirement

text: Pension benefits already equalized under this Agreement are excluded from retirement income when reviewing spousal support changes.
label: Pension income excluded if divided

text: Spousal support is suspended while recipient is cohabiting with another person in a relationship resembling marriage. Support may be reinstated if cohabitation ends.
label: Review When Cohabitation Ends

text: Spousal support may be reviewed when the youngest child starts school or turns age 12, or other triggering events listed in the Agreement occur.
label: Review when last child starts school

text: If parties are unable to agree on spousal support after a triggering event, the matter will be resolved under the Dispute Resolution section.
label: Dispute Resolution

text: Until adjusted by agreement, arbitration, or court order, spousal support continues under the most recent terms in force.
label: Payments Continue

text: Spousal support is indexed annually starting [date]. Adjustments use the CPI from three months before the indexing date.
label: Indexing Factor

text: Alternatively, spousal support may be increased by the actual percentage increase in payor's income for the prior year, if less than the CPI.
label: Increase other than by Indexing Factor

text: Alternatively, spousal support may be increased by the actual percentage increase in payor's income for the prior year, if less than the CPI.
label: Increase other than by Indexing Factor

text: Late spousal support payments will accrue interest at [number]% per year, compounded annually.
label: Interest on Late Payments

text: Spousal support will be enforced by the MAINTENANCE ENFORCEMENT AGENCY and this Agreement will be filed accordingly. Automatic deductions may apply.
label: Payment of Support through Enforcement Agency

text: Spousal support may be paid directly rather than through the enforcement agency, unless default occurs for more than [number] weeks—then enforcement may proceed.
label: Direct Payment of Support/Non-filing with Enforcement Agency

text: By December 1st each year, the payor must provide twelve post-dated cheques for spousal support for the upcoming year.
label: Post-Dated Checks

text: Spousal support may be paid via e-transfer to the recipient's designated email address on the first day of each month.
label: E-Transfers

text: Spousal support may be paid by direct deposit from the payor's bank to the recipient's bank on the first day of each month.
label: Inter-Bank Transfers

text: Spousal support may be paid by direct deposit from the payor's bank to the recipient's bank on the first day of each month.
label: Inter-Bank Transfers

text: Neither party will apply to a provincial or federal court to vary spousal support terms except as provided by this Agreement and under the specified provincial legislation.
label: No Variation or Indexing

text: Upon the terms of this Agreement, the parties release all present and future claims to spousal support, retroactively and prospectively. They are now financially independent.
label: Spousal Support Release

text: Even in the face of extreme, unforeseen, or catastrophic changes in life circumstances, neither party will be entitled to seek spousal support. Financial independence remains absolute.
label: No Variation of Spousal Support Release Permitted

text: If any court ever awards spousal support despite this Agreement, the equalization payment must be returned and recalculated.
label: Repayment of Equalization if Spousal Support Ordered

text: Parties acknowledge court rulings that override releases but agree this Agreement is to be enforced as a complete defense to any future spousal support claim.
label: Acknowledgement re Caselaw overturning Releases

text: Once spousal support ends, the payor may remove the recipient from health insurance coverage after 30 days' notice.
label: Termination of Coverage When Spousal Support Ends

text: Spousal support ending allows removal of the recipient from health coverage with 30 days' notice.
label: Termination of Coverage When Support Ends

text: If payment is late, interest at [rate]% applies after 14 days. Full payment may be accelerated, and additional penalties may apply including suspension of spousal support release.
label: Default Terms - Interest and/or Acceleration

text: Spousal support and property provisions are interdependent. Together they satisfy support objectives under the Divorce Act and provincial legislation.
label: Property and Support Interdependent

text: If one party is buying out the other, deductions may apply for notional real estate commission and legal expenses.
label: Notional Deductions on buyout

text: *PARTY 1* and *PARTY 2* were married or began cohabiting on [date].
label: Marriage [Cohabitation] Date

text: *PARTY 1* and *PARTY 2* were never married, nor did they cohabit. They agree the Divorce Act and INSERT PROVINCIAL LEGISLATION NAME HERE do not apply, despite references in the Agreement.
label: Never Married/Cohabited

text: *PARTY 1* and *PARTY 2* separated on [date] and will continue to live separate and apart.
label: Separation Date

text: *PARTY 1* and *PARTY 2* are separated and still live in the same home. One party will vacate the home upon execution of this Agreement and asset transfer.
label: Separation Date while Living in Same Property

text: The parties were divorced on [date].
label: Date of Divorce

text: *PARTY 1* was born on [date], age [x]; *PARTY 2* was born on [date], age [x].
label: Birthdate and Age

text: Both parties currently enjoy excellent health, or relevant health conditions are disclosed for support determination.
label: State of Health

text: The parties agree this Agreement settles all issues between them.
label: Agree to be Bound

text: Each party confirms they have provided full financial disclosure of income, assets, and debts relevant to the Agreement.
label: Importance of Full Disclosure

text: Each party has received legal advice about their rights under legislation and common law, including unjust enrichment and trusts.
label: Advised of Law

text: The parties negotiated in good faith, with independent advice, free of coercion, and accept the Agreement regardless of potential court outcomes.
label: Intentions/Circumstances re: Agreement

text: This Agreement was made with the help of a mediator, namely [specify name].
label: Assistance of Mediator

text: No legal applications have been started under the Divorce Act or INSERT PROVINCIAL LEGISLATION NAME HERE.
label: No Application Commenced

text: A legal application has been commenced under the Divorce Act or INSERT PROVINCIAL LEGISLATION NAME HERE. All prior orders are now incorporated or replaced by this Agreement.
label: Application Commenced

text: This Agreement incorporates the terms of a previously signed Memorandum of Settlement or Minutes of Settlement dated [date].
label: Incorporate Minutes of Settlement / MOBA

text: This Agreement replaces all prior oral or written agreements regarding marriage or relationship issues.
label: Replaces All Agreements

text: This Agreement replaces or modifies a previous domestic contract made on [date].
label: Replaces (varies) Domestic Contracts

text: *PARTY 1* and *PARTY 2* will continue to respect each other and each other's privacy.
label: Respect of/Freedom From The Other

text: Neither party will, by any act, omission, innuendo, comment or otherwise, interfere with, criticize, harass, or speak ill of the other, including the other's parenting, family, friends, employment, lifestyle choices or other decisions/actions.
label: Respect & Privacy

text: Neither party will seek to influence others against the other party.
label: Non influence of others

text: Neither party will go on property where the other lives or works without the other's consent.
label: Non-harassment and Non-trespass (No Children)

text: Neither party will go to the other's home except on reasonable notice and only for the purpose of picking up or dropping off the child(ren).
label: Non-harassment and Non-trespass (With Children)

text: If the parties cannot agree on a decision regarding the child, they will use the dispute resolution provision in this Agreement to resolve the dispute.
label: Dispute Resolution

text: Sole decision-making parent must first consult with the other parent in respect of all important decisions and provide their decision in writing in advance.
label: Consultation with other Parent

text: Health-related decisions will be made in consultation with doctors and health specialists and based on their recommendations when necessary.
label: Health Decisions per: Doctor

text: Education decisions include school selection, holding back or skipping grades, changing teachers, or switching schools.
label: Education Decisions

text: A child will be raised in a designated religion or will have no religious affiliation, as agreed.
label: Religious Upbringing

text: Neither party may change the child's name without the written consent of the other.
label: Name Change

text: Each party will hold and exchange the child's documents (e.g., passport, SIN, birth certificate) as reasonably required, and return them promptly.
label: Important Documents, including Passports

text: Either party may make inquiries and receive information from the child's teachers, medical providers, and others involved in their care. They will sign any authorization forms if required.
label: Information from Third Parties

text: Both parties agree to promote the child's best interests, support relationships with both parents, and avoid alienation or negative remarks.
label: Statement of Mutual Obligations and Communication Parameters

text: _____ will stay with _____ on Family Day Weekend in odd-numbered years and with _____ in even-numbered years, from after school on Friday until the start of school on Tuesday.
label: Family Day Weekend

text: _____ will stay with _____ during the Spring Break in odd-numbered years and with _____ in even-numbered years, from after school as the break starts until the start of school following the break.

text: _____ will stay with _____ on Victoria Day Weekend in odd-numbered years and with _____ in even-numbered years, from after school on Friday until the start of school on Tuesday.

text: The children will stay with _____ for [number] [consecutive or non-consecutive] weeks, during which time _____ regular parenting time will be suspended.

text: _____ will have first choice of Summer Vacation time in odd-numbered years and _____ will have first choice in even-numbered years. The party with first choice will advise the other, in writing, by [April 1st] of the chosen weeks; the other party will advise by [May 1st].

text: In making plans, each party will take into account _____ camp and other scheduled activities.

text: _____ will stay with _____ on Thanksgiving Weekend in odd-numbered years and with _____ in even-numbered years, from after school on the Friday before Thanksgiving until the start of school on Tuesday.

The first half starts after school on the last day of school in December and ends at [noon] on the halfway date; the second half runs from [noon] on the halfway date to the start of school in January.

text: Regardless of the Christmas Break schedule, _____ will stay with _____ on Christmas Eve/Morning until Christmas Day at [noon], and with _____ from [noon] on Christmas Day until [9:00 p.m.] on Boxing Day in odd-numbered years; the arrangement reverses in even-numbered years.

text: _____ will stay with _____ on Holika Dahan in odd-numbered years and with _____ in even-numbered years, from after school (or 4:00 p.m. if it is not a school day) until the start of school (or noon if it is not a school day) the next day.
