text: _____ will stay with _____ on Holi in odd-numbered years and with _____ in even-numbered years, from after school (or noon if it is not a school day) until the start of school (or noon if it is not a school day) the next day.
label: Holi – Main Day

text: _____ will stay with _____ for Diwali in odd-numbered years and with _____ in even-numbered years, from after school (or 4:00 p.m. if it is not a school day) until the start of school (or noon if it is not a school day) the next day.
label: Diwali

text: Both parties will provide each other with their email addresses, current addresses and a phone number where they can be reached at all times.
label: Contact Information

text: With respect to _____ transitions between the parties, where possible, will be picked up or dropped off directly at school. If the parenting time schedule contemplates a pick up or drop off at school, but _____ are not in school that day, the transition time will be 9:00 a.m. unless otherwise specified, and the party with _____ will be responsible for dropping her off at the end of the parenting time at the other party_____ home.
label: School Transitions

text: Neither party will object to the other's plans with _____ and each must respect the other's ability to care for _____ appropriately.
label: Respect for Each Other's Plans

text: Both parties may attend extracurricular activities and scheduled school events (as more particularly detailed below) regardless of the parenting time schedule.
label: Attendance at Extracurricular & School Events

text: _____ will be permitted to take any personal item, toy, gift or article of clothing between the parties' homes, without restriction.
label: Child's Personal Items

text: _____'s' health card will travel with _____ between the parties' homes.
label: Health Card Travels

text: Notwithstanding the above subparagraphs, the parties will at all times maintain a reasonable and flexible position respecting the parenting time schedule for _____ and at all times the best interests of _____ will prevail. Accordingly, if special occasions, extracurricular activities, excursions or other opportunities become available to _____, or to either party, neither party will insist that the parenting time schedule set out herein be adhered to without exception.
label: Flexibility & Best Interests

text: _____ and _____ agree that it is in _____'s best interests to spend time with the other party [or _____ grandparents] rather than with a third party. Accordingly, if a party with whom _____ is scheduled to be according to the parenting time schedule above [or that party's parent(s)] cannot care for _____, that party will notify the other party and give the other party [or the other party's parent(s)] the opportunity to do so. If the other party [or the other party's parent(s)] cannot care for _____, the party with whom the children are scheduled to be according to the parenting time schedule above will be solely and financially responsible for making alternate childcare arrangements.
label: Right of First Refusal – Either Parent

text: The parties agree that it is in _____'s best interests to spend time with _____ [or _____'s grandparents] rather than with a third party when _____ [or _____'s parent(s)] cannot care for _____. Accordingly, if _____ [or _____'s parent(s)] cannot care for _____, _____ will notify _____ and give _____ [or _____'s parent(s)] the opportunity to do so.
label: Right of First Refusal – Other Parent Unable

text: _____ and _____ may telephone, text, video conference, or email with _____ on a [once] daily basis. _____ may telephone, text, video conference, or email _____ or _____ whenever she wishes. The parties will respect _____ privacy during these communications.
label: Child-Parent Daily Communication

text: To facilitate this communication with _____, [_____ and _____ will share] [_____ (or _____) will pay] the cost of a cell phone and monthly plan for _____.
label: Child's Cell Phone
Social Media Posting
text: The parties will not post photos or videos of _____ on their social media accounts [without the consent of the other party] [unless their account remains private and access is given to the other party to view any post].
The parties will attend parent-teacher meetings [preferably together, but if that is not practical, then individually] [individually, or together if both parties consent].
label: Parent-Teacher Meetings

text: Each party will obtain their own school calendar and school notices.
label: Obtain School Notices

text: With respect to school field trips or classroom events, [the parties will alternate attendance. If one party is unable to attend, that party will immediately notify the other party, who may attend instead] [a party will only attend field trips and participate in classroom events when _____ is in that party_____ care according to the schedule].
label: Field Trips / Classroom Events

text: Grandparents will have reasonable telephone contact with _____.
label: Grandparents – Telephone Contact

text: [First obtain the other party's consent in writing, such consent not to be unreasonably withheld] before travelling [outside Canada] [outside (specify jurisdiction)] with _____.
label: Travel – Written Consent

text: The travelling party will give the other party a detailed itinerary at least [number] days before the vacation begins, including airline, flight times, accommodation (address and phone) and how to contact _____ during the trip.
label: Travel – Itinerary Notice

text: The travelling party will obtain a notarized travel authorization from the other party by providing a [draft letter] ["Travel Consent Form" substantially in the form attached] authorizing travel, to be executed and notarized [at the travelling party_____ expense].
label: Travel – Notarized Authorization

text: If either party plans a vacation without _____, the travelling party will give the other a telephone number where they can be reached in case of emergency or if _____ wishes to contact that party.
label: Vacation Without Child – Contact Info

text: If a party proposes to change their residence or that of [_____ within (number) kilometres from the municipal boundary of (area)], such that the other party_____ relationship with _____ will not be significantly impacted, the moving party will give written notice [at least 30 days before the proposed change] to the other party of: (i) the expected date of the change; (ii) the new address; and (iii) updated contact information[, including any new telephone number(s)].
label: Residence Change – Notice

text: A party intending to relocate with or without _____ in a way that significantly impacts the other party's relationship with _____ must give at least 60 days' written notice in the form prescribed by the [applicable legislation] [Divorce Act], setting out the expected date, new address and contact information, a proposal for parenting time[ and decision-making], and any other prescribed information.
label: Relocation – Notice Requirements

text: If an objection is served, the dispute will be resolved by [arbitration] [mediation/arbitration] [court application], as specified in this Agreement.
label: Relocation – Dispute Resolution

text: If (i) the parties reach an amending agreement, (ii) the non-relocating party does not object and there is no proceeding pending, or (iii) no award or court order prohibits the move, the relocating party may move as of the date in the notice or any applicable award/order.
label: Relocation – When Move Permitted

text: This relocation paragraph does not limit either party’s ability to take _____ out of the jurisdiction for travel in accordance with the travel term above.
label: Relocation – Travel Term

text: If both parties die, [name of chosen appointee(s)] will assume decision-making responsibility for _____. Both parties will make wills consistent with this section.
label: Death of Both Parents

text: Each party will obtain motor-vehicle insurance that includes $[amount] of third-party liability coverage for any vehicle the party (a) owns or leases; (b) uses to transport _____; or (c) permits _____ to drive.
label: Motor Vehicle Insurance

text: The parties wish to engage [name of mediator/arbitrator]. If that person cannot act, they will follow the same referral and selection process as set out above.
label: Mediation/Arbitration – Appointment

text: The parties will share the [up-front] cost of the mediation/arbitration [equally] [_____ % / _____ %].
label: Mediation/Arbitration – Cost Sharing

text: If the parties have not resolved the dispute through mediation after [number] days, the mediator/arbitrator will arbitrate the dispute[, and may reapportion costs].
label: Mediation/Arbitration – Arbitration After X Days

text: Any arbitration will be conducted under the Arbitration Act and will constitute a secondary arbitration under that Act and the Family Law Act.
label: Mediation/Arbitration – Arbitration Act & FLA

text: The mediator/arbitrator’s decision ("award") will be binding. The award may be appealed to the court [with leave on questions of law only] [as of right on questions of (law) (fact) (mixed law and fact)].
label: Mediation/Arbitration – Binding Award & Appeals

text: The parties will enter into a Mediation/Arbitration Agreement consistent with these terms[, attached as a Schedule to this Agreement].
label: Mediation/Arbitration – Agreement

text: Arrears will be paid in full within [number] days of Agreement date.
label: Arrears Paid in Full

text: Arrears will be paid in monthly installments of $[amount], starting [date], until paid in full.
label: Arrears Paid in Monthly Installments

text: A party pays less than the Table amount due to special provisions benefiting the child (e.g., equity transfer, exclusive home use, lump sum).
label: Special Provisions

text: A party pays less than Table amount due to high income exceeding $150,000. Contributions adjusted to match needs and fairness.
label: Payor's Income over $150,000

text: Reduced support is justified where the child is over the age of majority. This reflects actual dependency and fairness.
label: Children Over the Age of Majority

text: Undue hardship warrants reduced Table support due to household income disparities and financial burdens.
label: Undue Hardship

text: If undue hardship ends, the full Table amount and proportional section 7 expense sharing resumes automatically.
label: Fixed Termination Date For Undue Hardship

text: Section 7 expenses must be itemized annually, with each party contributing based on proportional income or fixed responsibility.
label: Current/Estimated Section 7 Expenses

text: Section 7 expenses will be allocated as follows: one party pays specific items upfront, the other reimburses proportionally based on agreed percentages.
label: Payment of Section 7 Expenses - One Party

text: Each party provides written proof of incurred section 7 expenses annually. Reimbursement is calculated after applying tax credits, subsidies, and support considerations.
label: Payment of Section 7 Expenses - Both Parties

text: Each party pays their respective upfront share of section 7 expenses, then balances are settled annually based on proportional income share.
label: Yearly Reconciliation of Section 7 Expenses - One Party

text: Future section 7 expenses include agreed-upon items (e.g., tutoring, medical, extracurricular). Disputes are resolved through the Agreement's dispute resolution process.
label: Yearly Reconciliation of Section 7 Expenses - Both Parties

text: Expenses not classified as section 7 include typical recurring costs such as food, clothing, field trips, and regular school supplies.
label: Agreement as to Future Section 7 Expenses

text: Parties will only contribute to future section 7 expenses if they provide written consent in advance. Consent will not be unreasonably withheld.
label: Agreement as to What are NOT Section 7 Expenses

text: Upon a terminating event, the responsible party must notify the other in writing. Failure to notify may result in reimbursement of overpaid support and legal costs.
label: Termination - Simple

text: If support obligations end for one child, the parties will review support for remaining children. Disagreements are resolved via dispute resolution.
label: Notice Of Terminating Event

text: Post-secondary education requires reviewing support amounts and adjusting based on reduced home expenses and new education costs.
label: Support Resumes if Child Returns to School

text: Full Table support continues during post-secondary education if the child remains at home with a parent or both parties.
label: Review if Child Lives at Home

text: When a child lives away for school, monthly support is adjusted or paused for specific months and blended over the year if needed.
label: Review if Child Lives away from Home

text: Each party contributes a percentage of the child’s post-secondary educational expenses based on agreed ratios or actual income.
label: No Change in Table Support

text: RESP contributions and balances are applied before allocating remaining educational costs. Reimbursement follows contribution ratios.
label: RESP

text: The parties will consider the child's reasonable financial contribution before allocating education expenses. Disputes go to mediation/arbitration.
label: Child's Contribution to Section 7 Expenses

text: Parties exchange income information annually by May 1st. Adjusted support and section 7 expense contributions take effect July 1st.
label: Disclosure - short form

text: Each party must disclose tax returns, earnings, and financial data under s. 21(1) of the Guidelines annually or within 30 days of request.
label: Disclosure - long form

text: If underpayment of Table support is discovered, the payor will pay the balance immediately or within 30 days.
label: Underpayment of Support

text: If overpayment occurred, the overpaying party may deduct the excess from future support in equal installments.
label: Overpayment of Support

text: Certain events do NOT qualify as material change, including minor income drops, short-term sabbaticals, or typical seasonal earnings.
label: What does not constitute a material change

text: A party requesting change must notify the other in writing, provide evidence, and request necessary supporting information.
label: Notice of Change

text: If the parties cannot agree on changes to support, the matter will be resolved through dispute resolution.
label: Dispute Resolution for “change

text: The Table amount may alternatively be increased based on the actual annual increase in the payor's income, if less than the indexing factor.
label: Increase Other Than by Indexing Factor

text: To adjust by income rather than CPI, the payor must disclose tax returns and supporting financial documents for the past two years.
label: Income versus CPI Indexing

text: If neither party initiates a review in a given year, the indexed adjustment applies automatically per the Agreement.
label: Indexing Pending Review

text: One party may claim any tax credits for low-income families, if applicable, as agreed.
label: Low Income tax credits

text: Parties may claim federal and provincial tax benefits for children living primarily with them, including Canada Child Benefit and GST/HST credits.
label: Claiming tax credits

text: Charitable donation credits for religious school tuition will be shared in proportion to the amount paid by each party.
label: For Religious School Tuition

text: If the child’s tuition tax credit is not fully used, either party may claim the unused portion if eligible.
label: For Post Secondary Educational Institution

text: If direct payment is agreed upon, either party may register this Agreement with the MAINTENANCE ENFORCEMENT AGENCY in case of default.
label: Direct payment or Registration with Maintenance Enforcement

text: If any cheque is returned NSF or unprocessable, the payor will reimburse the recipient for all resulting bank charges.
label: NSF checks

text: Interest on unpaid support balance will accrue at [number]% annually, compounded [monthly/annually], until paid.
label: Interest on late payments

text: Support is $[amount]/month starting [date], subject to review after [number] years. Disputes to be resolved under Dispute Resolution clause.
label: Periodic Support with Automatic Review

text: From [date] until sale of the matrimonial home, one party will cover realty taxes, utilities, insurance, and mortgage interest. These payments are deductible under Income Tax Act sections 56.1(2) and 60.1(2).
label: 3rd Party Payments re: Matrimonial Home (no children)

text: From [date] to [date], one party will pay specific spousal support-related expenses. Payments qualify for income tax treatment as support under the Act.
label: 3rd Party Payments with Tax Consequences

text: From [date] to [date], specified expenses will be paid but will not be treated as taxable income or deductions.
label: 3rd Party Payments without Tax Consequences

text: The payor will reimburse the recipient for extra income tax incurred due to retroactive spousal support, including penalties and interest if applicable.
label: Tax Reimbursement

text: Recipient must actively pursue self-sufficiency and provide evidence every 6 months of efforts to secure employment or retraining.
label: Contribution to Own Support

text: If recipient's income exceeds $[amount], the payor must be notified. Income documentation must be provided upon request.
label: Obligation to Notify

text: Any party seeking a change must notify the other in writing with evidence and a request for needed information.
label: Procedure

text: In the case of involuntary retirement, written notice must be provided immediately, and changes will apply from the date of retirement or notice, whichever is later.
label: Involuntary Retirement

text: Retiring party must submit a sworn Financial Statement and all relevant retirement benefit documentation.
label: Financial statement re: retirement

text: No obligation exists to disclose financial changes unless review clauses are activated, except in the case of retirement.
label: No Obligation to Notify of Changes Until Review Requested

text: If recipient is entitled to support from a new cohabitating partner, the current payor will not be obligated to continue payments.
label: Cohabitation Terminates Spousal Support

text: To apply income-based indexing, the payor must submit income tax returns and supporting documentation from the last two years.
label: Disclosure required

text: Index-based support increases require an amending agreement to be signed and filed with the court and enforcement agency.
label: Indexing Requires Amending Agreement

text: If arrears are paid late in a lump sum causing increased taxes, the payor will reimburse the excess tax burden as liquidated damages.
label: If Support Arrears Paid in Lump Sum

text: If the payor defaults on support, they are liable for all legal fees and expenses incurred by the recipient to enforce payment.
label: Costs Upon Default

text: If a cheque is returned or unprocessable, the payor is responsible for all related bank fees incurred by the recipient.
label: NSF checks

text: The parties intend this Agreement to be final, binding, and non-variable in all respects regarding spousal support.
label: Intention to Release of Spousal Support

text: Each party confirms that they received independent legal advice, negotiated fairly, and believe the Agreement equitably reflects the consequences of their relationship.
label: Fair negotiation

text: If a dispute arises, parties must first attempt negotiation directly or through counsel. The initiating party must provide written notice, evidence, and any relevant information requests.
label: Negotiation First

text: The responding party must answer within a set number of days. The parties will meet personally or via representatives to resolve the matter. Any resolution will be formalized in an amending agreement signed before witnesses.
label: Amending Agreement if resolution

text: If negotiation fails, the parties will engage a mutually agreed-upon mediator. Costs will be shared equally or as specified, and a mediation agreement will be signed.
label: Mediation

text: If mediation fails, the parties will engage a mediator/arbitrator. The process will follow the Arbitration Act and result in a binding award unless appealed under law.
label: Mediation/Arbitration

text: If unresolved through prior steps, the parties will engage an arbitrator under the Arbitration Act. The decision is binding and may be appealed on specific grounds.
label: Arbitration

text: If all alternative resolution methods fail, either party may apply to court with at least [number] days’ written notice.
label: Notice of Application

text: "Medical needs" include all mental and physical health services such as prescriptions, dental, vision, therapy, and alternative care. "Health insurance" includes medical, dental, and extended benefits.
label: Medical and Health Insurance Definitions

text: If neither party has health insurance, each is responsible for their own medical needs.
label: Where No Health Insurance Available

text: The supporting party must maintain the recipient as a beneficiary under their employment health insurance plan, for as long as coverage is available.
label: Payor to Maintain Health Insurance

text: If allowed, the supporting party will authorize direct claims by the recipient to the insurer and direct reimbursement to the recipient.
label: Authorization

text: If direct claim is not possible, the supporting party will submit receipts and forward reimbursements promptly via endorsement or e-transfer.
label: Reimbursement with receipts

text: If health insurance lapses, replacement private insurance must be obtained immediately, provided it's reasonably available.
label: Replacement Insurance

text: If coverage ceases, written notice must be given. Medical costs incurred before notice must be reimbursed. Afterward, each party covers their own needs.
label: No Replacement Insurance

text: If neither party has health insurance, and support for a child continues, they will share the child’s medical costs equally or in proportion to income.
label: Where No Health Insurance Available

text: The supporting party must keep the child listed as a beneficiary under employment insurance for as long as support is required.
label: Payor to Maintain Health Insurance

text: Both parties may hold the child as a beneficiary under their respective plans. Reimbursement claims and payments must be coordinated cooperatively.
label: Both to Maintain Health Insurance

text: If neither plan is available, the obligated party must acquire private insurance for the child, if reasonably available.
label: Replacement Insurance

text: If coverage ends unexpectedly, written notice is required. Medical costs incurred before notice must be reimbursed. Future expenses are shared based on agreement.
label: No Replacement Insurance

text: Orthodontic costs will be paid with prior written consent from the other party, not to be unreasonably withheld. Disputes go to resolution.
label: Orthodontic Expenses

text: Uncovered medical costs will be shared equally or in proportion, unless pre-approval was not obtained. Disputes go to resolution.
label: Uncovered Medical Expenses

text: Parties without insurance must each pay their own medical costs and share child-related expenses based on agreement or section 7 rules.
label: Where No Health Insurance Available

text: While support is owed, parties must maintain the supported child as a health insurance beneficiary and handle claims/reimbursements cooperatively.
label: Payor to Maintain Health Insurance

text: If both parents support the same child, both will maintain the child under insurance. Reimbursement must be prompt and coordinated.
label: Spouse and Both to Maintain Health Insurance for Children

text: If insurance becomes unavailable, new private coverage must be obtained immediately to avoid coverage gaps, provided it is reasonably priced.
label: Replacement Insurance

text: Written notice is required if coverage ends. Parties will reimburse costs incurred before notice and share expenses thereafter.
label: No Replacement Insurance

text: Orthodontic treatment will be covered with prior consent. If the parties cannot agree, dispute resolution is required.
label: Orthodontic Expenses for Children

text: Uninsured medical expenses are shared equally or in proportion. Consent must be obtained beforehand unless the issue is resolved through dispute resolution.
label: Uncovered Medical Expenses for Children

text: The insurer must notify the other party in writing of any changes or termination of health coverage in a timely manner.
label: Notice to other party

text: If a party fails to maintain required insurance, they must repay the other for any resulting losses or uncovered expenses.
label: Health Coverage Indemnity

text: A party owns a life insurance policy through employment in the amount of $[amount]. The full face value is available and unencumbered.
label: Existing Life Insurance

text: A party will apply for a life insurance policy in the amount of $[amount], and undergo any required medical exams.
label: Alternate - New Individual Policy

text: Parties will jointly apply for life insurance on one party’s life in the amount of $[amount], with shared ownership as specified (e.g., joint tenancy).
label: Alternate - New Joint Policy

text: The policyholder must pay premiums on time. If another party pays to prevent lapse, the amount is treated as support and reimbursable.
label: Obligation to Pay Premiums

text: Trustees may be appointed to manage insurance proceeds on behalf of children, with detailed trust terms attached or referenced.
label: Alternate - Third Party Trustee

text: If obligated to pay spousal support, the policyholder will keep the policy active and designate the recipient as irrevocable beneficiary for outstanding obligations.
label: Life Insurance to Secure Spousal Support

text: Prior to signing, the policyholder will provide a copy of the policy and irrevocable beneficiary designation, and sign an Authorization and Direction form.
label: Proof of Policy and [Irrevocable] Beneficiary Designation

text: Annual proof of premium payment will be provided within 14 days of each policy anniversary.
label: Proof of Premium Payments

text: Once support obligations end, the policyholder may terminate the irrevocable beneficiary designation. If refused, a court order may be pursued.
label: Release of Irrevocable Beneficiary Designation - Individual Policy

text: Upon termination of support, the policyholder will transfer policy ownership. If refused, a court order may be obtained at the refusing party’s cost.
label: Alternate - Release of Interest - Joint Policy

text: If the existing policy lapses or cannot be maintained, replacement insurance must be secured immediately at a reasonable cost.
label: Replacement Coverage

text: If the policyholder dies, their estate continues paying support obligations until insurance proceeds are received.
label: Death of Policy Owner

text: If the required policy is not in force at death, the recipient has a lien against the estate for the full amount of support owed.
label: Lien Against Estate

text: The policy amount may be reviewed every [number] years to determine if a change is warranted based on remaining support obligations and other factors.
label: Review of Policy Amount

text: The policy amount may be automatically reduced every [number] years by $[amount] or by [percentage] %.
label: Automatic Reduction of Policy Amount by Specified Amount or Percentage

text: A fixed schedule may be used to reduce the required policy amount, beginning on a specified date with set reduction amounts.
label: Alternate - Automatic Reduction of Policy Amount according to Schedule

text: If premiums increase materially, the parties may renegotiate policy terms or cost-sharing. Disputes will be resolved via dispute resolution clause.
label: Review if Material Increase in Premium Payments

text: The amount of required insurance is variable and subject to adjustment in the event of a material change in circumstances.
label: Variable if Material Change in Circumstances

text: Any issue regarding insurance coverage amount or changes will be resolved using the dispute resolution procedures in the Agreement.
label: Dispute Resolution-Life Insurance

text: The parties have agreed on a division of property based on the attached calculations and will divide property accordingly.
label: Property

text: A payment of $[amount] will be made via certified cheque by [date/time] to complete the property equalization settlement.
label: Settlement of Family Property

text: This payment satisfies all equalization claims of the INSERT PROVINCIAL LEGISLATION NAME HERE, unless otherwise addressed in the pension section.
label: Settlement under Provincial law

text: To secure payment, the RRSP plan holder will restrict RRSP transfers without written consent until all payments under this Agreement are complete.
label: Security for Payment

text: Investment account assets will be transferred in equal shares between the parties as of a specified valuation date.
label: Investment Accounts

text: Joint bank accounts will be divided equally unless otherwise specified. Individual accounts will remain with their respective owners.
label: Bank Accounts

text: RRSP transfers under section 146(16) of the Income Tax Act will be completed, including execution of Form T2220 and tax-free rollover.
label: RRSP Transfers

text: The recipient of the RRSP transfer is responsible for any taxes or fees on collapse or transfer, except their own income tax.
label: RRSP Transfers Tax Consequences

text: Corporate shares will be transferred to the transferee who will assume all liabilities. The transferor will resign from all positions and release future claims.
label: Shares

text: Capital assets may be transferred on a tax-free rollover basis.
label: Transfer of Capital Property as a Rollover

text: Joint election under s. 74.5(3)(b) of the Income Tax Act will be filed to avoid attribution of taxable capital gains. The transferee indemnifies the transferor.
label: Alternate - Transfer of Capital Property with Joint Election

text: A capital asset may be transferred at fair market value. The transferor may elect out of rollover provisions under s. 73(1) of the Income Tax Act.
label: Alternate - Transfer of Capital Property at Fair Market Value

text: Vehicle ownership will be transferred. The original owner will cover any transfer documentation and indemnify the new owner from liabilities until insured.
label: Vehicles

text: Airline rewards will be equalized by direct transfer, cash equivalent, or booking travel of equivalent value depending on program rules.
label: Airline Rewards

text: The transferor declares no prior income tax liabilities. Any liability arising from transferred property will be indemnified by the transferor and enforceable by judgment.
label: Indemnity for Tax Liabilities

text: The support and property sections are interdependent and fulfill objectives under the Divorce Act by recognizing economic impact, allocating child-related financial burdens, relieving hardship, and promoting self-sufficiency.
label: Alternate - Interdependent Clause

text: All property, income tax, and financial transfers set out in this Agreement are binding and enforceable as final settlement unless otherwise varied by mutual agreement or court order.
label: Intention of Agreement to be Binding

text: The parties own the matrimonial home jointly or as tenants-in-common.
label: Ownership - Joint / Tenants-in-Common

text: One party is the sole registered owner of the matrimonial home.
label: Alternate - Sole Ownership

text: The joint tenancy in the matrimonial home is severed, and it is now held as tenants-in-common.
label: Severance of Joint Tenancy

text: Upon signing the Agreement, a party will transfer full title of the matrimonial home to the other, free of encumbrances, and cover related costs.
label: Transfer of Home in Settlement

text: One party transfers their interest in the matrimonial home to the other for a set amount or calculated value. Transfer costs are allocated.
label: Alternate - Transfer of Home for Value

text: Both matrimonial home and cottage transfers will be completed upon signing, with parties covering registration costs as agreed.
label: Mutual Transfer of Home and Cottage

text: Any encumbrance registered after signing and before transfer must be cleared by the responsible party, who will indemnify the other.
label: Encumbrance Registered before Transfer

text: The parties agree on the matrimonial home's value, optionally based on a designated appraiser.
label: Value of Matrimonial Home

text: If no agreed value, the matrimonial home will be appraised jointly. If appraisals differ, the average or third-party appraisal determines the value.
label: Alternate - Value of Matrimonial Home by Jointly Retained Appraiser

text: Responsibility for existing mortgage payments, penalties, fees, and discharge lies with the assuming party. They will indemnify the other if a release is not secured.
label: Existing Mortgage - Release or Indemnity

text: If mortgage release is not obtained, the responsible party must refinance and discharge the existing mortgage.
label: Alternate - Existing Mortgage - Release or Refinance

text: Both parties designate the home as their principal residence up to the transfer date. Any tax from breach will be reimbursed by the breaching party.
label: Principal Residence

text: Transfer of the matrimonial home must be completed within 60 days of signing the Agreement. Sanctions apply if not completed on time.
label: Date for Completion of Transfer and Sanctions for Delay

text: Once transfer is complete, the transferor releases all rights under the INSERT PROVINCIAL LEGISLATION NAME HERE.
label: Release Property Rights in the Matrimonial Home

text: Parties will list the matrimonial home for sale by a specified date and accept the first reasonable offer. Disputes go to resolution.
label: Agreement to List and Sell

text: If the sale cannot be agreed upon, the parties consent to a judicial sale under provincial legislation. Either may apply to court.
label: If Agreement Cannot be Reached

text: One party may retain exclusive possession of the matrimonial home until closing, covering daily expenses and sharing major expenses as agreed.
label: Exclusive Possession Until Sale

text: "Daily household expenses" include utilities, internet, security, and small repairs. "Major repairs" are defined separately and exclude cosmetic upgrades.
label: Household Expenses

text: Daily expenses will be paid by the party in exclusive possession.
label: Daily Expenses

text: Major expenses will be split equally or in a specified ratio. One party may cover and be reimbursed from sale proceeds.
label: Major Expenses

text: Neither party will incur major home expenses without the other's written consent.
label: Consent Required for Major Expenses

text: Proceeds from sale will first pay sale-related expenses, agreed reimbursements, and joint debt before the balance is divided equally or as agreed.
label: Sale Proceeds

text: While a party has exclusive possession, the other will co-sign or guarantee mortgage renewals/replacements up to a specified amount.
label: Mortgage Renewal

text: The guaranteeing party is indemnified from any loss or liability resulting from the mortgage guarantee.
label: Indemnity for any losses from Mortgage renewal

text: Until sale, parties hold title as joint tenants or tenants-in-common. Severance restrictions may apply.
label: Ownership until Sale

text: The home will be sold when the youngest child finishes school, one party remarries or cohabits, or by a specific date.
label: Delayed Sale of the Home

text: Household contents have been divided to the parties’ mutual satisfaction.
label: House Contents Already Divided

text: Household contents have been divided per the attached Schedule to this Agreement.
label: Divided per Schedule

text: Parties agree to divide household contents equally and execute an acknowledgment. If they cannot agree, they will resolve it via dispute resolution.
label: Division with Assistance if Necessary

text: The parties have joint debts listed in the Agreement. Each assumes responsibility for specific debts and agrees to use best efforts to release the other from liability.
label: Joint Debts

text: Until released from a joint debt, neither party will incur additional charges on the account. The responsible party will indemnify the other.
label: No additional charges included

text: Each party will be solely responsible for their personal debts and will indemnify the other from any liability related to those debts.
label: Separate Debts

text: All jointly held credit cards will be cancelled upon signing this Agreement. Each party assumes the balance for designated accounts.
label: Joint Credit Cards

text: If a party becomes liable for a credit card or other debt assumed by the other, the assuming party will fully indemnify them.
label: Credit Card Indemnity

text: One party will assume responsibility for shared liabilities such as a mortgage or line of credit, and will use best efforts to obtain a release for the other party.
label: Joint Line of Credit/Mortgage Debts Assumption and Release

text: Family loans evidenced by promissory notes are to be assumed by the designated party, who will indemnify the other and obtain a release with proof.
label: Family Loans

text: If one party has exclusive possession of the home, the other will remain a guarantor until released. They must sign mortgage renewals within one week of request.
label: Guarantor for home until released

text: Loans between the parties are forgiven where noted and no repayment will be expected.
label: Loans between Parties

text: Neither party may pledge or bind the other's credit after the signing of this Agreement. Both confirm no such pledges have occurred since separation.
label: Pledge of Credit

text: A party obligated to indemnify must reimburse all losses, expenses, or legal fees incurred by the other, and pay interest on amounts covered under this Agreement.
label: Indemnities

text: Either party may apply for a division of Canada Pension Plan credits.
label: Canada Pension Plan

text: Where pension value is not included in net family property, it will be divided according to the Pension Benefits Act (PBA) and Agreement terms.
label: Pension under the Provincial Pensions - Intention to Equalize and Divide Pension

text: Where pension value is to be equalized, it will be valued but not divided. It will be included in net family property and equalized accordingly.
label: Intention to Equalize/Divide Pension as Part of Property Equalization

text: Definitions such as AVCs, EMCs, Family Law Valuation Date, Plan, Plan Administrator, and transfer ratio apply to all pension-related clauses.
label: Definitions

text: The Family Law Valuation Date is the agreed or court-ordered date of separation for pension valuation purposes.
label: Separation date

text: The maximum transferable value from the Plan to the non-member is specified, with options such as LIRA, LIF, RRSP, or another pension plan.
label: Maximum transferable value specified in Pension Division Letter

text: The transfer will be made as a lump sum to a registered account designated by the non-member spouse.
label: Lump Sum Transfer to spouse

text: Parties agree to cooperate fully, complete all forms, and submit documentation to facilitate pension transfer.
label: Full cooperation required

text: No party will take actions that jeopardize pension division. If they do, remedies such as support recalculation or equalization adjustment may apply.
label: No party to jeopardize pension division

text: If the pension member dies before the lump sum is transferred, the value will be paid to the estate of the non-member.
label: Death of Pension Member

text: All transfers are in pre-tax dollars. Tax consequences are accounted for in the equalization or as separately addressed.
label: Tax Consequences

text: Where a retired pension is already in pay, instalments may be divided or converted into a combined pension payable to the recipient.
label: Division Option 1 - Division of Pension Instalments

text: Arrears from the valuation date to transfer date may be recovered through increased instalments to the non-member and decreased instalments to the member.
label: Division of installments  - Arrears in payment

text: The Plan Administrator will be directed to act in accordance with the Agreement, including adjusting payments for arrears and enforcing division terms.
label: Pension Administrator to be Directed by Agreement

text: Waivers of survivor benefits may be executed using prescribed forms. The waiver terms vary depending on the pension's pay status and the agreement structure.
label: Waiver/Release of Survivor Benefits

text: If one party dies before waiver or transfer is complete, alternative outcomes such as transfer to estate or cancellation of division may apply.
label: Death of party before waiver

text: The Agreement may allow a combined pension to be paid in lieu of dividing instalments or survivor benefits.
label: Alternate - Payment Lump Sum (Special Circumstances)

text: All pension division-related applications, will be completed as required.
label: All pension forms completed

text: If no division is pursued through the PBA, parties agree to equalize pension value through net family property instead.
label: No Division of Pension Benefits/Pension by Plan Administrator

text: Additional Voluntary Contributions (AVCs) and Excess Member Contributions (EMCs) earned during the relationship are equalized through property division.
label: Additional Voluntary Contributions (AVCs)

text: Survivor benefits are considered part of net family property and included in the equalization payment.
label: Equalization of Family Law Value of Spouse's Survivor Benefits

text: Any pension transfer made under the PBA is in before-tax dollars, and tax adjustments have been applied in the equalization calculation.
label: Tax Consequences

text: One party waives all claims to survivor benefits and acknowledges they are not entitled to joint or survivor benefits under the Plan.
label: One Party Waives Survivor Benefits

text: If the pension is already in pay, the parties will execute Pension Form (Post-retirement Waiver) to formally waive survivor benefits.
label: Pension in Pay

text: If the pension is not to be divided, the parties will execute Pension Form FL-8 and submit it to the Plan Administrator to waive survivor entitlements.
label: Waiver form if no division

text: After pension transfers or divisions are complete, all further claims to the pension, including survivor and death benefits, are fully released.
label: Release After Division

text: "PBDA" means the Pension Benefits Division Act. This governs public service pensions subject to federal division rules.
label: Federal Pensions

text: The Plan under PBDA is a federally regulated pension such as one governed by the Public Service Superannuation Act or Supplementary Retirement Benefits Act.
label: Pensions under PBDA

text: The parties confirm the pension was accumulated during the relationship and that 50% is due to the non-member, either now or upon division.
label: 50% of pension is due to the non-member

text: Pension value will not be included in net family property but instead paid directly under the PBDA and per this Agreement.
label: Federal Pension not included in Net Family Property

text: Either party may apply under section 4(1) of the PBDA for division of pension benefits. Both parties will fully cooperate.
label: Either Party Can Apply for division

text: The application to divide PBDA benefits includes confirmation of separation, addresses, dates of birth, employer info, and waiver of objections under PBDA.
label: Application includes details of relationship

text: The Minister will transfer 50% of the pension value earned during the relationship into a registered retirement vehicle selected by the non-member.
label: Minister to transfer 50% of pension value to non-member

text: If the maximum transferable amount under provincial legislation is less than agreed pension value, the member party will pay the difference to the other.
label: Maximum Transferable Amount -Shortfall Paid by Member

text: Transferred pension funds are in before-tax dollars. Equalization calculations reflect the gross value.
label: Tax Consequences

text: A specified lump sum will be transferred to a retirement account of the non-member, pursuant to PBDA rules.
label: Lump Sum Transfer

text: If the non-member dies before transfer completion, the funds will be transferred to their estate.
label: Death Before Transfer is Completed

text: Until transfer is complete, the member acts as trustee for the other party’s interest and must ensure all communications are shared.
label: Member Acts as Trustee

text: The member must authorize the Plan to release information directly to the other party and notify the administrator of all pension terms in this Agreement.
label: Authority to Release Information to Other Party

text: If the member fails to comply with trust terms, the other party may obtain a court order without notice to protect their pension interest.
label: Non Compliance of Terms

text: The pension member irrevocably directs the Plan Administrator to comply with the terms of this Agreement and protect the non-member’s pension interests.
label: Irrevocable Direction to Plan Administrator

text: The member must designate the non-member as irrevocable beneficiary of $[amount] in life insurance to secure pension-related obligations if they die before obligations are satisfied.
label: Non Member Irrevocable Beneficiary

text: If the agreed method of pension division cannot be completed, the non-member retains a 50% interest in benefits earned during the relationship.
label: When Pension Division Cannot be Completed

text: If the parties cannot agree on alternative pension arrangements, the issue will be resolved by Dispute Resolution or a court of competent jurisdiction.
label: Dispute Resolution

text: The parties agree to waive any applicable limitation periods and to execute any amendments needed to give full effect to this Agreement.
label: Waiver of Limitation Periods

text: This Agreement is a full and final settlement of all issues between the parties and all rights and obligations arising from their relationship.
label: General Release - Short Form

text: Except as otherwise provided, the parties release each other from all claims at common law, equity, or by statute, including under the Divorce Act, the INSERT PROVINCIAL LEGISLATION NAME HERE, the Provincial Property Division Act, and any Estate/Wills/Probate Acts.
label: General Release - Long Form

text: This Agreement satisfies all claims previously made in Court File No. [court file number] in the [specify court] at [City, Province].
label: Full and Final Satisfaction of All Claims in Outstanding Court Application

text: This Agreement is a domestic contract under the INSERT PROVINCIAL LEGISLATION NAME HERE and prevails over matters addressed in that legislation.
label: Domestic Contract

text: This Agreement constitutes the complete and final understanding between the parties. No other terms, warranties, or representations exist.
label: No Representations

text: If parties reconcile for 90 days or less, this Agreement remains in effect. After 90+ days of cohabitation, the Agreement becomes void, except for transfers already completed.
label: Reconciliation

text: If any provision is invalid or unenforceable, it is severed without affecting the remainder of the Agreement.
label: Severability

text: Section headings are for convenience only and do not affect interpretation.
label: Headings

text: On execution of this Agreement, either party may proceed to obtain a divorce judgment, incorporating this Agreement if applicable, with no costs payable.
label: Application Already Commenced

text: Parties will cooperate in any divorce application and proceed on an uncontested basis. Service of documents will be facilitated.
label: Application to be Commenced by One Party

text: Parties may agree to share divorce-related costs equally, or assign them to one party.
label: Application to be Commenced by Either Party

text: Specified paragraphs of this Agreement may be incorporated into the divorce order with the parties' consent.
label: Costs to be Borne by One Party

text: None of the Agreement terms will be incorporated into the divorce order if the parties so agree.
label: Costs to be Shared

text: All terms of this Agreement will survive a divorce judgment or order.
label: Clauses to be Incorporated in Judgment/Order

text: Parties agree to remove religious barriers to remarriage and will cooperate in obtaining a religious divorce or annulment.
label: Religious Barriers to Remarriage

text: PROVINCE law applies unless otherwise agreed. Jurisdiction is with the PROVINCIAL HIGH COURT or other specified court.
label: Applicable Law and Interpretation

text: This Agreement binds and benefits the parties’ heirs, executors, administrators, and legal representatives.
label: Agreement To Bind Estate

text: Parties will inform their estate representatives of the existence and location of this Agreement.
label: Inform Personal Representatives

text: All amendments must be in writing, signed, dated, and witnessed.
label: Amendments

text: Parties will sign any documents necessary to carry out the intent of this Agreement.
label: Execution Of Other Documents

text: Parties disclose all income, assets, and debts as of the marriage/cohabitation date, separation date, and signing of this Agreement.
label: Financial Disclosure

text: Each party is satisfied with financial disclosure and investigation. Courts may set aside terms for nondisclosure of significant assets or debts.
label: Financial Investigation

text: Where no financial disclosure was requested, each party waives further disclosure and agrees it is irrelevant to the terms of this Agreement.
label: Disclosure Waiver

text: Financial statements or statements of income, assets, debts, and excluded property may be attached as Schedules to this Agreement.
label: Financial Statements Attached

text: Failure to enforce any term is not a waiver of that term.
label: Non-compliance

text: Each party pays their own legal and preparation costs related to this Agreement.
label: Costs

text: Parties confirm they received independent legal advice and understand the nature, consequences, and fairness of this Agreement.
label: Independent Legal Advice

text: If a party declines legal advice, they acknowledge this in writing by executing a Waiver of Independent Legal Advice.
label: Independent Legal Advice Declined

text: Consent required under this Agreement will not be unreasonably withheld. Disputes over consent will be resolved under the Dispute Resolution section.
label: Where Consent is Required in Agreement

text: The Agreement may be signed in counterparts, via electronic means, and delivery by email or fax is acceptable and binding.
label: Execution - Counterparts; Electronic Signature/Delivery

text: The effective date of this Agreement is the date on which the last party signs it.
label: Effective Date

text: This Agreement was prepared jointly by both parties.
label: Preparation
